result.execSummary:
Herman E. Haehlen was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Herman E. Haehlen was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Herman E. Haehlen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Herman E. Haehlen in court, in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews fugitive complaint, warrant issued in Illinois. State advises of procedure. Court questions Defendant, who thinks it is probable there's a warrant for him, didn't tell them that he had to come to Court here. Court questions Defendant on whether he wants to go back and get that taken care of. Defendant wants to go back. Court questions Atty Pelrine on whether he is aware of basis of revocation. Defendant makes statement regarding reason for trip to Door County. Court has no doubt that Defendant is the person referred to in the warrant, does not know basis of probation revocation. Court does not think bail should be set, believes Defendant should be sent to Illinois. State advises of bond set in other file, requests that bond be set with hearing date. Court advises Defendant that he has right to an attorney. Defendant states that he will sign a waiver. State provides copy of form. Court reads form, questions Defendant, who wants to waive extradition, talked to his attorney yesterday when he was taken into custody. Court is satisfied that Defendant is waiving extradition freely and voluntarily. Defendant signs waiver.
